quote: There is no such thing as a single-issue struggle because we do not live single-issue lives.
We must not allow ourselves to become like the system we oppose.
When will our consciences grow so tender that we will act to prevent human misery rather than avenge it?
Washing one’s hands of the conflict between the powerful and the powerless means to side with the powerful, not to be neutral.
People must take a modicum of public responsibility for each other even if they have no ties to each other.
We have a world to conquer…one person at a time…starting with ourselves.
We must use time creatively, and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right.
It is not enough to be compassionate – you must act.
The people are the only ones capable of transforming society.
Do not wait for extraordinary circumstances to do good; try to use ordinary situations.
There will be no Homeland Security until we realize that the entire planet is our homeland. Every sentient being in the world must feel secure.
Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of overcoming it.
Take your easy tears somewhere else. Tell yourself none of this ever had to happen. And then go make it stop. With whatever breath you have left. Grief is a sword or it is nothing.
Nothing that is worth doing can be achieved in our lifetime; therefore we must be saved by hope.
During times of universal deceit telling the truth becomes a revolutionary act.

To be human, at the most profound level, is to encounter honestly the inescapable circumstances that constrain us, yet muster the courage to struggle compassionately for our own unique individualities and for more democratic and free societies.
If you are trying to transform a brutalized society into one where people can live in dignity and hope, you begin with the empowering of the most powerless. You build from the ground up.
Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
I swore never to be silent whenever and wherever human beings endure suffering and humiliation. We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim.
The more you move, the stronger you’ll grow….
